alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 1:25PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WESTERN ULSTER...EASTERN GREENE...AND WESTERN GREENE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 125 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Westerlo to near Willowemoc and moving southeast at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This squall will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Western Ulster, northwestern Eastern Greene and Western Greene Counties. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Western Greene; Western Ulster
